abstract: The size of paper for a print job and the rectangular area that the content prints within.
overview:
## Overview

In most cases, UIKit automatically creates an instance of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper] that is appropriate for a print job. The UIKit framework has default paper sizes based on a print job’s output type ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/outputType-swift.property] is a property of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo] class). If the output type is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/OutputType-swift.enum/photo], the default paper size is 4x6 or A6 or some other standard size, depending on locale; if the output type is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/OutputType-swift.enum/general] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/OutputType-swift.enum/grayscale], the default paper size is US Letter (8 1/2 by 11 inches) or A4 or some other standard size, depending on locale.

Applications may have special requirements for paper sizes. For example, a word-processing application may have items of “stationery” in which printable content must be drawn. If your application fits the special case, the delegate of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] can implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionControllerDelegate/printInteractionController(_:choosePaper:)] method of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionControllerDelegate] protocol to return a suitable print paper object. One way to do this is to call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper/bestPaper(forPageSize:withPapersFrom:)] class method of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper], passing in a array of print paper objects representing the paper sizes supported by a printer. The print paper object returned from this method represents the paper size best matched to the size requirement of the application.

The printable rectangle ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper/printableRect]) is the imageable area for the printer on a paper of a given size.

If you are using a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer] object to draw the content for printing, the rectangle stored in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper/printableRect] property is stored in the page renderer’s property of the same name and the paper size used for a print job is stored as part of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/paperRect] property.
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper
crawled: 2025-12-03T05:29:53Z
---

# UIPrintPaper

**Class**

The size of paper for a print job and the rectangular area that the content prints within.

## Declaration

```swift
class UIPrintPaper
```

## Overview

In most cases, UIKit automatically creates an instance of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper] that is appropriate for a print job. The UIKit framework has default paper sizes based on a print job’s output type ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/outputType-swift.property] is a property of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo] class). If the output type is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/OutputType-swift.enum/photo], the default paper size is 4x6 or A6 or some other standard size, depending on locale; if the output type is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/OutputType-swift.enum/general] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInfo/OutputType-swift.enum/grayscale], the default paper size is US Letter (8 1/2 by 11 inches) or A4 or some other standard size, depending on locale.

Applications may have special requirements for paper sizes. For example, a word-processing application may have items of “stationery” in which printable content must be drawn. If your application fits the special case, the delegate of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] can implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionControllerDelegate/printInteractionController(_:choosePaper:)] method of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionControllerDelegate] protocol to return a suitable print paper object. One way to do this is to call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper/bestPaper(forPageSize:withPapersFrom:)] class method of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper], passing in a array of print paper objects representing the paper sizes supported by a printer. The print paper object returned from this method represents the paper size best matched to the size requirement of the application.

The printable rectangle ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper/printableRect]) is the imageable area for the printer on a paper of a given size.

If you are using a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer] object to draw the content for printing, the rectangle stored in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPaper/printableRect] property is stored in the page renderer’s property of the same name and the paper size used for a print job is stored as part of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/paperRect] property.

## Getting the paper size and the printing area

- **paperSize**: The size of the sheet to use for printing.
- **printableRect**: The rectangle that represents the portion of the paper that can be imaged upon.

## Obtaining the best paper size for printing

- **bestPaper(forPageSize:withPapersFrom:)**: The print-paper object that UIKit determines to be the best for a print job based on the specified page size and the paper size–imageable area combinations specific to the printer.

## Deprecated

- **printRect()**: Deprecated.

## Job info

- **UIPrinter**: A printer on the network.
- **UIPrintInfo**: Information about a print job that the system uses when it prints.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
